result.execSummary:
The defendant James Anthony Crawford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Anthony Crawford

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed, notice of completion of representation

Defendant James Anthony Crawford in court with attorney Sarah B Joseph.  Defendant James Anthony Crawford in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for sentencing hearing. The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.  

Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONCURRENT to any other sentence with credit for 103 DAYS time served. Huber privileges for treatment.  

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections Mental Health Unit for a period of 15 MONTHS.

OTHER/CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Complete any and all other counselling deemed appropriate.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens.
* Restitution set at ZERO. 
* NO CONTACT WITH; Mayfair Mall and ICINGS, Sarah R., and Bayshore Mall.
* Pay supervision fees to the Department of Corrections. 
* Provide DNA Sample and pay surcharge during the period of probation or  CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.
* Court waived ALL other fees due to indigency. 

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief; Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Due to the congestion of the Court's calendar, matter is RESCHEDULED to 01-11-2019 at 08:30 am for Sentencing.  Counsel to appear at 08:30 am.  sdg
Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Attorney Sarah B Joseph in Court, Defendant James Anthony Crawford not in Court, in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Defendant not produced for today's hearing. Discussion placed on the record regarding the status of this mater. State moves to REVOKE DPA.
Court ordered case adjourned for Revocation / Sentencing hearing. State to comply with Victim Notification. Case remains calendared in Branch 33.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 14, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant previously posted $75.00.  Balance due is $275.00.  Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Mayfair Mall and Icing Store

Attorney Sarah B Joseph in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.
Pretrial Credit, received and filed.

Defendant James Anthony Crawford in court with attorney Sarah B Joseph.  Michael Damon Phillips appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  


The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the case transferred to Judge Ashley, Branch 33 for a review hearing.  Review hearing scheduled for March 5, 2018 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant James Anthony Crawford in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Compentency hearing proceeded. Sworn in for the STate:  Dr. Robert Rawski. Exhibit one received. State rests. Sworn in for the Defense:  James Crawford. Defense rests. Cause argued. Court found defendant competent to proceed.

Defendant James Anthony Crawford in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(4)(a), Wisconsin Statutes, copies of the doctor's report are forwarded to Assistant District Attorney and to the defendant's Attorney. Defense is challenging the findings in the report.  Forensic unit notified of the hearing date.  Competency hearing scheduled for 06-30-2015 at 08:30 am.
Case is adjourned to branch 47 for return on doctor's report.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for 05-20-2015 at 01:30 pm.
